    • Constructor Detail

      • CorpsJoystick

        public CorpsJoystick(int port,
             int numAxes,
             int numButtons,
             double XDZMin,
             double XDZMax,
             int XMult,
             double XMax,
             double YDZMin,
             double YDZMax,
             int YMult,
             double YMax,
             double twistDZMin,
             double twistDZMax,
             int twistMult,
             double twistMax)
        Construct an instance of CorpsJoystick. The joystick index is the USB port on the drivers station. CHSJoystick constructor allows user to configure dead zones, multipliers (square/cube/etc. joystick axis inputs), and maximum outputs.
        Parameters:
        port - Port on the driver station that the joystick is plugged into.
        numAxes - Number of axis types in the Joystick class enumeration.
        numButtons - Number of button types in the Joystick class enumeration.
        XDZMin - Minimum extreme of the x-axis dead zone, above which values will be returned as 0.
        XDZMax - Maximum extreme of the x-axis dead zone, below which values will be returned as 0.
        XMult - Multiplier for values from the X axis. 2 will square input, 3 will cube input, etc.
        XMax - Maximum (absolute value) output for X axis: should be a percentage (<1) or 1 for 100%. Inputs will be multiplied by this value before being returned. To invert the axis, make this value negative.
        YDZMin - Minimum extreme of the y-axis dead zone, above which values will be returned as 0.
        YDZMax - Maximum extreme of the y-axis dead zone, below which values will be returned as 0.
        YMult - Multiplier for values from the Y axis. 2 will square input, 3 will cube input, etc.
        YMax - Maximum (absolute value) output for Y axis: should be a percentage (<1) or 1 for 100%. Inputs will be multiplied by this value before being returned. To invert the axis, make this value negative.
        twistDZMin - Minimum extreme of the twist or z-axis dead zone, above which values will be returned as 0.
        twistDZMax - Maximum extreme of the tiwst or z-axis dead zone, below which values will be returned as 0.
        twistMult - Multiplier for values from the twist/Z axis. 2 will square input, 3 will cube input, etc.
        twistMax - Maximum (absolute value) output for twist/Z axis: should be a percentage (<1) or 1 for 100%. Inputs will be multiplied by this value before being returned. To invert the axis, make this value negative.

      • CorpsJoystick

        public CorpsJoystick(int port,
             int numAxes,
             int numButtons)
        CHSJoystick three-parameter constructor. Sets number of axes and number of buttons, and defaults to no dead zones, no limit on max outputs, and squaring inputs.
        Parameters:
        port - The port on the driver station that the joystick is plugged into.

      • CorpsJoystick

        public CorpsJoystick(int port)
        CHSJoystick default one-parameter constructor. Sets default dead zone, multiplier, and maximum output values. Defaults to 4 axes, 12 buttons, no dead zones, no limit on max outputs, and squaring inputs.
        Parameters:
        port - The port on the driver station that the joystick is plugged into.

    • Method Detail

      • getX

        public double getX(edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.GenericHID.Hand hand)
        Get the X value of the current joystick. This depends on the mapping of the joystick connected to the current port. Method implements dead zone, multiplier, and max speed percent initialized in constructor.
        Overrides:
        getX in class edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Joystick
        Parameters:
        hand - Passed to super method - unused.
        Returns:
        The X value of the joystick.

      • getZ

        public double getZ(edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.GenericHID.Hand hand)
        Get the Z value of the current joystick. If the joystick has over 3 axes, it returns the same value as getTwist. Otherwise, it returns the same value as getThrottle. This depends on the mapping of the joystick connected to the current port.
        Overrides:
        getZ in class edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Joystick
        Parameters:
        hand - Unused.
        Returns:
        The twist/throttle/Z value of the joystick.

      • isDead

        public boolean isDead()
        Returns true if all axes are within their dead zones, meaning all joystick outputs are zero. Does not take throttle into account.
        Returns:
        If the joystick is stopped.

      • toggleButton

        public boolean toggleButton(int button)
        Button toggle method. Press a button once to return true; press it again to return false. Method prevents unintentional toggling by keeping track of the current button state.
        Parameters:
        button - Which button is used to toggle the state.
        Returns:
        The current toggle state of the button.

      • resetToggle

        public void resetToggle(int button)
        Reset toggle method makes the toggle state for the button false. Sets previous state to the state before reset.
        Parameters:
        button - Which button is used for the toggle.

      • setXDeadZone

        public void setXDeadZone(double minimum,
                double maximum)
        Set a dead zone for the X axis on the current joystick.
        Parameters:
        minimum - Minimum extreme of the x-axis dead zone, above which values will be returned as 0.
        maximum - Maximum extreme of the x-axis dead zone, below which values will be returned as 0.

      • setXMaxOutput

        public void setXMaxOutput(double maxOutput)
        Set maximum (absolute value) output for the X axis on the current joystick. maxOutput should be a percentage (<1) or 1 for 100%. Inputs will be multiplied by this value before being returned. To invert the axis, make this value negative.
        Parameters:
        maxOutput - Maximum (absolute value) output of the x-axis.

      • setXScale

        public void setXScale(int curve)
        Set rate/curve for values from the X axis. 2 will square input, 3 will cube input, etc.
        Parameters:
        curve - Scale/Rate for values from the X axis.
